p: The influence of the solvent, phenological stage, and host on α-amylase and α-glucosidase inhibition by various extracts is presented in Figure 3. Extract from P. capitata collected on P. americana and P. guajava presented higher inhibitory activities (low IC 50 compared to acarbose whose dose-activity is showed in Supplementary material) at vegetative and fruiting stages. With P. mannii, this inhibitory activity increased significantly during flowering and more at fruiting ( Figure 3(a)). Ethyl acetate, methanol, and hexane extracts had the best inhibitory activity against α-amylase.
